title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement rmagno@pattern.institute. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to mgi.report.reader
text: outlines propose change alz.

title: Contributing to mgi.report.reader
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to mgi.report.reader
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to mgi.report.reader
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("patterninstitute/alz", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to mgi.report.reader
text: use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to mgi.report.reader
text: Please note alz project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help
text: Thank using alz! GitHub account, please file issue question bug report. GitHub account, can contact Ramiro Magno, maintainer package rmagno@pattern.institute.

what: McKhann et al. (1984): The clinical turn
title: Redefining Alzheimer's: From Symptoms to Biomarkers
text: landmark consensus paper, McKhann et al. (1984) established first widely adopted clinical diagnostic criteria Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) joint auspices National Institute Neurological Communicative Disorders Stroke (NINCDS)1 Alzheimer’s Disease Related Disorders Association (ADRDA)2. Briefly, criteria introduced three-tier classification system, reflecting increasing levels diagnostic certainty: Possible AD: cases atypical features presence comorbid conditions contribute dementia, Alzheimer’s disease remains likely diagnosis; Probable AD: clinical diagnosis based insidious onset progressive memory cognitive decline, absence alternative explanations3; Definite AD: requires criteria Probable AD, combined histopathological confirmation Alzheimer’s-specific brain lesions autopsy biopsy. Although grounded clinical observation, framework acknowledged absence specific biomarkers high misclassification rate4 clinical practice.

what: Blacker et al. (1994): Toward refining diagnostic accuracy
title: Redefining Alzheimer's: From Symptoms to Biomarkers
text: Blacker et al. (1994) conducted multisite study evaluate reliability validity NINCDS-ADRDA diagnostic criteria Alzheimer’s disease (AD), originally proposed (McKhann et al. 1984). Using autopsy-confirmed diagnoses gold standard, study assessed well clinicians across three academic centers classify 60 cases (AD non-AD) based detailed clinical summaries. findings supported moderate inter-rater reliability good post-consensus validity criteria, also revealed important diagnostic limitations—especially atypical presentations. Key recommendations refining criteria: Early behavioral symptoms (e.g. personality change, disinhibition) often associated non-AD pathologies, Pick’s disease hippocampal sclerosis. authors suggested cases classified probable possible AD future criteria. Prominent early language dysfunction (e.g. progressive aphasia) also frequently corresponded non-AD pathology. authors proposed cases diagnosed possible AD , otherwise typical. distinction probable possible AD showed little difference predictive value, questioning usefulness treating hierarchically distinct terms diagnostic certainty. study highlighted need greater clarity temporal relationships cognitive decline co-occurring neurological psychiatric symptoms, common source diagnostic error. 5 authors advocated future formal revisions criteria incorporate observations—many already reflected clinical judgment experienced diagnosticians. work laid groundwork future revisions AD diagnostic frameworks, including NIA-AA criteria (N) biomarker model, underscoring limits symptom-based classification need refine criteria atypical mixed presentations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ramiro Magno. Author, maintainer. Pattern Institute. Copyright holder, funder.            https://www.pattern.institute

title: Authors and Citation
text: Magno R (2025). alz: Criteria Diagnosis Staging Alzheimer's Disease. R package version 0.0.1, https://www.pattern.institute/alz/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {alz: Criteria for Diagnosis and Staging of Alzheimer's Disease},   author = {Ramiro Magno},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://www.pattern.institute/alz/}, }

title: Criteria for Diagnosis and Staging of Alzheimer's Disease
Criteria for Diagnosis and Staging of Alzheimer's Disease
text: Please note alz project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Alzheimer's disease analytes — analytes
text: Returns tibble containing curated metadata directly measurable analytes relevant Alzheimer's disease research. includes amyloid beta peptides, total tau, phospho-tau isoforms, neurofilament light chain (NfL), GFAP, alpha-synuclein.

title: Alzheimer's disease analytes — analytes
text: tibble following columns: analyte_id Unique identifier analyte. Based ChEBI UniProt, suffixes specificity. analyte_name Concise scientific label (e.g., "Aβ42", "p‐tau181"). analyte_full_name Expanded form analyte name. molecular_type NCIT concept code corresponding molecular class, e.g. "peptide", "protein", based NCIT vocabulary. description Brief description analyte's biological function relevance Alzheimer's disease.

title: Alzheimer's disease analytes — analytes
text: table provides standardized identifiers, human-readable names, molecular types based NCIT terminology, concise descriptions biological relevance. analyte_id values drawn external ontologies ChEBI UniProt, optionally suffixed reflect post-translational modifications (e.g. P10636-pT181) structural fragments (e.g. P10636-MTBR243).

title: Alzheimer's disease analytes — analytes
code: analytes() #> # A tibble: 12 × 5 #>    analyte_id     analyte_name analyte_full_name      molecular_type description #>    <chr>          <chr>        <chr>                  <chr>          <chr>       #>  1 CHEBI:64647    Aβ42         Amyloid beta 1-42      C735           42-amino a… #>  2 CHEBI:64646    Aβ40         Amyloid beta 1-40      C735           40-amino a… #>  3 P10636-pT181   p‐tau181     Phosphorylated tau at… C1897          Tau protei… #>  4 P10636-pT202   p‐tau202     Phosphorylated tau at… C1897          Emerging t… #>  5 P10636-pT205   p‐tau205     Phosphorylated tau at… C1897          Tau protei… #>  6 P10636-pT217   p‐tau217     Phosphorylated tau at… C1897          Highly spe… #>  7 P10636-pT231   p‐tau231     Phosphorylated tau at… C1897          Potential … #>  8 P10636-MTBR243 MTBR‐tau243  Microtubule-binding r… C20385         Fragment o… #>  9 P10636         t‐tau        Total tau              C735           Full-lengt… #> 10 P07196         NfL          Neurofilament light c… C735           Axonal dam… #> 11 P14136         GFAP         Glial fibrillary acid… C735           Astrocytic… #> 12 P37840         αSyn         Alpha-synuclein        C735           Presynapti…

title: Open assay reference document — assay_doc
text: assay_doc() opens technical fact sheet associated given assay. useful quickly checking specific assay implementations.

title: Open assay reference document — assay_doc
text: assay_id character string representing assay identifier (e.g. "innotest-ab42-csf"). Check assays() options.

title: Open assay reference document — assay_doc
text: Called side effect. Opens PDF document system viewer.

title: Alzheimer's disease assays — assays
text: Returns tibble containing curated metadata assay implementations used measure fluid imaging biomarkers relevant Alzheimer's disease research. row describes specific combination vendor, platform, technology used quantify given analyte. Assays represent product-specific implementations (e.g., Elecsys, Simoa HD-X, INNOTEST) produce numeric measurements downstream biomarker classification. Quantitative performance parameters lower upper limits quantification (LLOQ, ULOQ) included available.

title: Alzheimer's disease assays — assays
text: tibble following columns: assay_id Unique identifier assay. analyte_id Reference measured analyte (see analytes()). modality Either "fluid" "imaging", denoting type measurement. matrix Biological specimen used, "CSF", "plasma", "brain". lloq Lower limit quantification, appropriate units. uloq Upper limit quantification. unit Measurement unit (e.g., "pg/mL", "SUVR"). technology Underlying method used (e.g., "ELISA", "PET", "Simoa"). vendor Manufacturer assay. platform Commercial platform product line name. description Descriptive label assay.

title: Alzheimer's disease assays — assays
code: assays() #> # A tibble: 20 × 11 #>    assay_id     analyte_id modality matrix  lloq    uloq unit  technology vendor #>    <chr>        <chr>      <chr>    <chr>  <dbl>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>      <chr>  #>  1 innotest-ab… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF    225    1452   pg/mL ELISA      Fujir… #>  2 innotest-ab… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF      3.4 10000   pg/mL ELISA      Fujir… #>  3 lumipulse-g… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF     NA      NA   pg/mL CLEIA      Fujir… #>  4 lumipulse-g… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF     NA      NA   pg/mL CLEIA      Fujir… #>  5 euroimmun-a… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF      6.5   641   pg/mL ELISA      EUROI… #>  6 euroimmun-a… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF    153   11000   pg/mL ELISA      EUROI… #>  7 innogenetic… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF     NA      NA   pg/mL ELISA      Innog… #>  8 innogenetic… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF     NA      NA   pg/mL ELISA      Innog… #>  9 msd-ab42-csf CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF      3    1500   pg/mL ECLIA      MSD    #> 10 msd-ab40-csf CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF     10    2500   pg/mL ECLIA      MSD    #> 11 xmap-ab42-c… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF     25    1700   pg/mL xMAP       Fujir… #> 12 xmap-ab40-c… CHEBI:646… fluid    CSF     20    2500   pg/mL xMAP       Fujir… #> 13 elecsys-pta… P10636-pT… fluid    CSF      0.5  1200   pg/mL ECLIA      Roche  #> 14 lumipulse-p… P10636-pT… fluid    CSF      1    1500   pg/mL CLEIA      Fujir… #> 15 simoa-ptau1… P10636-pT… fluid    plasma   0.2   500   pg/mL Simoa      Quant… #> 16 simoa-nfl-p… P07196     fluid    plasma   2    1800   pg/mL Simoa      Quant… #> 17 simoa-nfl-c… P07196     fluid    CSF      1    2500   pg/mL Simoa      Quant… #> 18 simoa-gfap-… P14136     fluid    plasma   0.5  1200   pg/mL Simoa      Quant… #> 19 pet-tau-flo… P10636     imaging  brain    0.3     3   SUVR  PET        AVID   #> 20 pet-amyloid… CHEBI:646… imaging  brain    0.3     2.5 SUVR  PET        AVID   #> # ℹ 2 more variables: platform <chr>, description <chr>

title: Alzheimer's disease biomarkers — biomarkers
text: Returns tibble curated biomarkers relevant Alzheimer's disease related neurodegenerative conditions. entry represents measurable biological imaging marker, including original analyte-derived biomarkers computed ratios derived indicators.

title: Alzheimer's disease biomarkers — biomarkers
text: tibble following columns: bmk_id Short identifier biomarker (e.g., "ab42", "ptau181_ab42_ratio"). bmk_name Human-readable label (e.g., "Aβ42 / Aβ40", "Amyloid PET"). bmk_category Biomarker classification: "core", "non-specific", "co-pathology". bmk_subcategory ATN co-pathology label: "", "T1", "T2", "N", "", "V", "S". bmk_modality Measurement domain: "fluid", "imaging", "hybrid". bmk_type Whether biomarker "original" (directly measured) "derived" (computed). analyte_ids List analyte IDs used compute define biomarker. bmk_desc Concise description biological relevance measurement rationale. notes Optional comments implementation notes.

title: Alzheimer's disease biomarkers — biomarkers
text: Biomarkers classified according category (e.g., core, non-specific, co-pathology), modality (fluid, imaging), 2024's ATN related subcategory ("", "T1", "T2", "N", "", "V", "S"). original derived biomarkers supported, links underlying analyte(s) included provenance.

title: Alzheimer's disease biomarkers — biomarkers
code: biomarkers() #> # A tibble: 20 × 9 #>    bmk_id            bmk_name bmk_category bmk_subcategory bmk_modality bmk_type #>    <chr>             <chr>    <chr>        <chr>           <chr>        <chr>    #>  1 ab42              Aβ42     core         A               fluid        original #>  2 ab42_ab40_ratio   Aβ42 / … core         A               fluid        derived  #>  3 amyloid_pet       Amyloid… core         A               imaging      original #>  4 ptau217           p-tau217 core         T1              fluid        original #>  5 ptau181           p-tau181 core         T1              fluid        original #>  6 ptau231           p-tau231 core         T1              fluid        original #>  7 ptau181_ab42_rat… p-tau18… core         T1              fluid        derived  #>  8 ptau217_np217_ra… p-tau21… core         T1              fluid        derived  #>  9 ptau205           p-tau205 core         T2              fluid        original #> 10 mtbr_tau243       MTBR-ta… core         T2              fluid        original #> 11 np_tau            Non-pho… core         T2              fluid        original #> 12 tau_pet           Tau PET  core         T2              imaging      original #> 13 ttau_ab42_ratio   t-tau /… core         T2              fluid        derived  #> 14 nfl               NfL      non-specific N               fluid        original #> 15 mri_atrophy       Anatomi… non-specific N               imaging      original #> 16 fdg_pet           FDG PET  non-specific N               imaging      original #> 17 gfap              GFAP     non-specific I               fluid        original #> 18 syn_saa           αSyn-SAA co-pathology S               fluid        original #> 19 mri_wmh           MRI inf… co-pathology V               imaging      original #> 20 ct_infarct        CT infa… co-pathology V               imaging      original #> # ℹ 3 more variables: analyte_ids <list>, bmk_desc <chr>, notes <lgl>

what: Classify biomarker values based on thresholds and quantification limits — classify
title: Classify biomarker values based on thresholds and quantification limits — classify
text: classify() general-purpose function discretising continuous biomarker values categorical levels based user-defined cut-points. also handles values outside quantifiable range, using optional labels values lower limit quantification (LLOQ) upper limit (ULOQ), provided via names loq argument.

title: Classify biomarker values based on thresholds and quantification limits — classify
code: classify(   x,   cutpoints,   levels,   loq = c(-Inf, Inf),   right = TRUE,   include.lowest = TRUE )

title: Classify biomarker values based on thresholds and quantification limits — classify
text: x Numeric vector biomarker values. cutpoints Numeric vector cut-points. Must strictly increasing. levels Character vector classification labels, length equal length(cutpoints) + 1. loq Numeric vector length 2 specifying quantification limits: lower (LLOQ) upper (ULOQ). Default: c(-Inf, Inf). Optionally, can name elements assign labels values outside range, e.g.: c("LLOQ" = 100, "ULOQ" = 2000). right Logical. Intervals right-closed (.e. (, b]). Default: TRUE. include.lowest Logical. Include lowest value first interval. Default: TRUE.

title: Classify biomarker values based on thresholds and quantification limits — classify
text: factor classification levels, including optional labels values outside quantifiable range.

title: Classify biomarker values based on thresholds and quantification limits — classify
code: classify(   x = c(10, 75, 130, 2050),   cutpoints = c(50, 150),   levels = c("low", "medium", "high"),   loq = c("Below LLOQ" = 20, "Above ULOQ" = 2000) ) #> [1] Below LLOQ medium     medium     Above ULOQ #> Levels: Below LLOQ low medium high Above ULOQ

what: Classify biomarker into binary categories using a single threshold — classify_binary
title: Classify biomarker into binary categories using a single threshold — classify_binary
text: classify_binary() function assigns values two categories based single numeric threshold. Values threshold receive first label levels, values equal threshold receive second label. Values lower limit quantification (lloq) upper limit quantification (uloq) returned NA.

title: Classify biomarker into binary categories using a single threshold — classify_binary
code: classify_binary(   x,   cutpoint,   levels = c("negative", "positive"),   loq = c(-Inf, Inf) )

title: Classify biomarker into binary categories using a single threshold — classify_binary
text: x Numeric vector biomarker values. cutpoint Single numeric cut-point separating two categories. levels Character vector length 2, specifying labels values threshold, respectively. Defaults c("negative", "positive"). loq Numeric vector length 2. Limits quantification: lower upper limits. Defaults c(-Inf, Inf) limits.

title: Classify biomarker into binary categories using a single threshold — classify_binary
text: factor two levels, NA values outside quantifiable range.

what: Classify biomarker into ternary categories using two thresholds — classify_ternary
title: Classify biomarker into ternary categories using two thresholds — classify_ternary
text: function assigns values three ordered categories using two numeric thresholds. default classification : Values strictly lowest cutpoints → "negative" Values cutpoints values → "indeterminant" Values equal highest cutpoints → "positive" Interval boundaries right-closed. Values outside quantifiable range .e. loq values returned NA.

title: Classify biomarker into ternary categories using two thresholds — classify_ternary
code: classify_ternary(   x,   cutpoints,   levels = c("negative", "indeterminant", "positive"),   loq = c(lloq = -Inf, uloq = Inf) )

title: Classify biomarker into ternary categories using two thresholds — classify_ternary
text: x Numeric vector biomarker values. cutpoints Numeric vector cut-points, sorted ascending. levels Character vector length 3. Default c("negative", "indeterminant", "positive"). loq Numeric vector length 2. Limits quantification: lower upper limits. Defaults c(-Inf, Inf) limits.

title: Classify biomarker into ternary categories using two thresholds — classify_ternary
text: factor three levels, NA values outside quantifiable range.

what: Limits of quantification per method — loq
title: Limits of quantification per method — loq
text: loq() convenience function retrieves limits quantification one assays assays().

title: Limits of quantification per method — loq
Limits of quantification per method — loq
text: assay_id method identifier. One values assay_id variable assays().

title: Limits of quantification per method — loq
text: named numeric vector two elements: lloq, lower, uloq, upper, limits quantification.

title: Limits of quantification per method — loq
code: # Limits of quantification of Fujirebio INNOTEST β-Amyloid(1-42) CSF ELISA # Check `assays()` for available methods and associated identifiers. loq(assay_id = "innotest-ab42-csf") #> lloq uloq  #>  225 1452   # Likewise, for Beta-Amyloid(1-40) loq(assay_id = "innotest-ab40-csf") #>    lloq    uloq  #>     3.4 10000.0

title: Get package name — pkg_name
text: pkg_name() returns package name.

title: Get package name — pkg_name
text: Package name character.
